questions.question: I asked …………………………… what he was doing there.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of the verb should be in its object form. Object pronouns are: him, her, me, us, them, you and it.

questions.question: Why are you yelling at ………………………….?
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: I am convinced that ………………………….. is lying to me.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the subject of a verb should be in its subject form. Subject pronouns are: he, she, they, we, I, you and it.

questions.question: It took ……………………………… quite some time to get used to living alone.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of the verb should be in its object form. Object pronouns are: him, her, me, us, them, you and it.

questions.question: I waited for …………………………….. but he didn’t come.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: The child is waiting for ……………………………… mother.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: Don’t interfere with …………………………….
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: I don’t want to see ………………………………
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of the verb should be in its object form. Object pronouns are: him, her, me, us, them, you and it.

questions.question: Why don’t you listen to ………………………………….?
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: I have invited all of ……………………………. to my party.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: None of …………………………….. are interested in this.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.
